history.content: To declare CS, be sure to submit your application by May 30. If you want to declare as a double major, then you can attach your double major application to your application, and we will return it when we declare you. As you say, though, in terms of getting priority for upper div CS courses, it may be quicker to declare CS and add the second major afterward. You can always send the double major paperwork to cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu later in the summer or in the fall. Just don't forget to do it.

I finished the pre-reqs for both CS and my second major this semester and want to declare a double major in both.

However, I especially want to declare in CS as soon as possible to get the reserved seats for the fall, so would it be faster to first declare in CS as a single major and then add a second major over the summer? Or submit the double major form for CS first and then get approved for my second major to add them both at the same time?

Essentially, will one of the ways be faster in allowing me to declare in CS?
history.subject: Declaring a Double Major vs Single Major first
